topic.title: Centralization vs Decentralization | Web 2.0 vs 3.0
topic.body:
When will that expected change come? Like we all use the 4G network, when are we officially transforming into web 3.0? Who'll be the king of the new web? Google? Will Google be forced to close as a result of everyone porting to privacy focused browsers? 

Only time will tell. 

But the responsibilities of answering the bringing to reality the questions above are vested on a very few number of people while others "enthusiasts" sit back to enjoy these innovations. 

The success of web 3.0 depends on everyone's contributions.

1564655403_1EhJMLVMZUfhiFBYi9pkjzoaFzBNe.body:
> [styromaniac](#comment_793_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): Thing is that P2P software is cost savings for any who adopt it. Netflix liked WebTorrent and might be using it. Microsoft distributes Windows updates via P2P technology. [...]

Well said.

> [filips](#comment_110_1LFu1BTScmY82HHtg3TY2jAuSrCYNsQWEY): Web 3.0 is not a specific technology (except Ethereum client libraries with the same name). It is just a term to describe everything decentralized. [...]

Well analyzed.
